intro: Aeschynanthus myrmecophilus, commonly known as the ant-loving ivy, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of red and orange, which bloom in clusters along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its unique relationship with ants, where the plant provides shelter and food, contributes to its common name.
